Description: This template deploys the Artifactory web-application onto a STIG-hardened EL7-based Linux instance

InstancePrivateIPv4.Description: Private IP address of launched instance

AdminPubkeyURL.Description: (Optional) URL of file containing admin group's SSH public-keys

AkaList.Description: Comma-delimited list of FQDNs that should be accepted as valid names to service requests on behalf of.

AmiId.Description: ID of the AMI to launch

ArtifactoryClusterHome.Description: FQDN of NFS server hosting Artifactory's cluster-shared components

ArtifactoryClusterKey.Description: A hexadecimal string used to secure intra-cluster communications (ignored if "ClusterHome" is null; use `openssl rand -hex 16` to generate)

ArtifactoryClusterMaster.Description: Whether this node is a cluster's master node (ignored if "ClusterHome" is null)

ArtifactoryDbHost.Description: Fully-qualified domain name of the (externalized) Artifactory configuration database-host/cluster

ArtifactoryDbInstance.Description: Instance-name of the Artifactory configuration database

ArtifactoryDbAdminUser.Description: Name of the Artifactory configuration database's privileged user account

ArtifactoryDbAdminPasswd.Description: Password for the Artifactory configuration database's privileged user account

ArtifactoryRepoUrl.Description: URL/location of the repository definition-file that configures Artifactory RPM download capability.

ArtifactoryRpmName.Description: Name of the Artifactory installation-RPM. Include release version if 'other-than-latest' is desired. Example values would be: jfrog-artifactory-pro, jfrog-artifactory-pro-X.Y.Z

ArtifactoryS3BakupLocs.Description: Name of the S3 bucket used as destination for automated backups.

ArtifactoryS3ShardLocs.Description: Name of the S3 bucket(s) used as destination for sharded artifact storage (use a colon-delimited list if more than one bucket will be used)

ArtifactoryToolBucket.Description: Name of the S3 bucket containing installers, licenses, etc.

CloudWatchAgentUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to CloudWatch Agent installer. Example: s3://amazoncloudwatch-agent/linux/amd64/latest/AmazonCloudWatchAgent.zip

InstanceRoleProfile.Description: (Optional) IAM instance profile-name to apply to the instance

InstanceRoleName.Description: (Optional) IAM instance role-name to use for signalling

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

NoPublicIp.Description: Controls whether to assign the instance a public IP. Recommended to leave at "true" _unless_ launching in a public subnet

NoReboot.Description: Controls whether to reboot the instance as the last step of cfn-init execution

NoUpdates.Description: Controls whether to run yum update during a stack update (on the initial instance launch, Watchmaker _always_ installs updates)

PrivateIp.Description: (Optional) Set a static, primary private IP. Leave blank to auto-select a free IP

RootVolumeSize.Description: Size in GB of the EBS volume to create. If smaller than AMI defaul, create operation will fail; If larger, root device-volume's partition size will be increased

SecurityGroupIds.Description: List of security groups to apply to the instance

SubnetId.Description: ID of the subnet to assign to the instance

ToggleCfnInitUpdate.Description: A/B toggle that forces a change to instance metadata, triggering the cfn-init update sequence

WatchmakerAdminGroups.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain groups that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerAdminUsers.Description: (Optional) Colon-separated list of domain users that should have admin permissions on the EC2 instance

WatchmakerComputerName.Description: (Optional) Sets the hostname/computername within the OS

WatchmakerConfig.Description: (Optional) Path to a Watchmaker config file.  The config file path can be a remote source (i.e. http[s]://, s3://) or local directory (i.e. file://)

WatchmakerEnvironment.Description: Environment in which the instance is being deployed

WatchmakerOuPath.Description: (Optional) DN of the OU to place the instance when joining a domain. If blank and "WatchmakerEnvironment" enforces a domain join, the instance will be placed in a default container. Leave blank if not joining a domain, or if "WatchmakerEnvironment" is "false"
